name: Lydia Montenegro

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Those Ghouls wont be bothering us anymore, will they?{self important snob congratulating the player}

topics.topic_text: I hear you're the person to see about buying stuff for my suite.
topics.response_text: Good to see that old suite finally found an owner.

topics.topic_text: Can you tell me what the items do?
topics.response_text: Of course I can!

topics.topic_text: Tell me about your Themes.
topics.response_text: Some people don't like living in a boring old suite.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to change my house's Theme.
topics.response_text: Okay, consider it done. Anything else?

topics.topic_text: Okay, let me take a look at your stuff.
topics.response_text: Sure thing!

topics.topic_text: Enough about the suite. Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Okay.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the My First Infirmary.
topics.response_text: If you're wounded or you've hurt one of your limbs badly, this setup will allow you to heal it up as good as any other Wasteland Doctor.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the Jukebox.
topics.response_text: If you feel like filling your place with a whole bunch of music, switch this beautiful pre-war antique on.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the My First Laboratory.
topics.response_text: This setup is great for experimenting and coming up with all sorts of useful concoctions.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the Nuka-Cola Machine.
topics.response_text: One push of a button and you can get your hands on an Ice Cold Nuka-Cola!

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the Workbench.
topics.response_text: If you feel like tinkering and want to build some custom gizmos, this setup will help you do it.

topics.topic_text: That's enough about the items.
topics.response_text: Sounds good.

topics.topic_text: I'm interested in the Vault Theme.
topics.response_text: Feeling a bit homesick are we?{coy}

topics.topic_text: I'm interested in the Raider Theme.
topics.response_text: Into the blood and guts look, eh?{coy}

topics.topic_text: I'm interested in the Wasteland Explorer Theme.
topics.response_text: Longing for the great outdoors are we?{coy}

topics.topic_text: I'm interested in the Science Theme.
topics.response_text: You're the intellectual type, eh?{coy}

topics.topic_text: I'm interested in the Pre-War Theme.
topics.response_text: Feeling a bit nostalgic are we?{coy}

topics.topic_text: I'm interested in the Love Machine Theme.
topics.response_text: Feeling a bit anxious, perhaps?{coy}

topics.topic_text: Let me ask about something else.
topics.response_text: Sure.

topics.topic_text: Actually, let me pick another Theme.
topics.response_text: Certainly!

topics.topic_text: Sounds good to me.
topics.response_text: Well then, let's make a deal!

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about the basement?
topics.response_text: What are you talking about? You mean the basement of Tenpenny Tower? What a random question. Why should I know anything about a basement?{confused and snippy, she is high class lady, what use does she have for grubby basements?}

topics.topic_text: What if all your other neighbors agree?
topics.response_text: Then my neighbors will have lost their minds. Just like you have. Now go away.{self important snob}

topics.topic_text: Whatever.
topics.response_text: Who let you in here in the first place? Does Mister Tenpenny know there's a lunatic walking around his tower?{self important snob losing patience}

topics.topic_text: This is happening. You're going to have to deal with it, or get forced out.
topics.response_text: You horrible little zombie-lover! What right do you and your disgusting buddies have to push honest, hardworking, important people around like that?{bigot facing retribution}

topics.topic_text: I don't care. Get your stuff together and get out of here.
topics.response_text: Just you wait. I'll find a way to repay you for this.{bigot promising revenge}

topics.topic_text: I'm sure you'll find something suitable, don't worry.
topics.response_text: Don't worry? Did you just step out of a vault? Haven't you seen what's out there? I'm doomed. And it's all your fault!{defeated bigot trying to make hero feel bad}

topics.topic_text: Good luck.
topics.response_text: When I die, it'll be your fault.{defeated bigot trying to make hero feel bad}

topics.topic_text: I could kill a Ghoul or two, if I had to.
topics.response_text: I bet you could. Talk to Gustavo. He could use someone like you. You could kill those Ghouls in the tunnels. Get rid of them once and for all!{getting excited}

topics.topic_text: When I see a Ghoul in the distance, I tend to turn around and go the other way.
topics.response_text: Well, that's not very brave, though it's not a bad policy either. If you decide to conquer your fear of Ghouls by killing a couple, talk to Gustavo.{disappointed}

topics.topic_text: Ghouls are all right.
topics.response_text: What? Have you lost your mind?{clearly the person she is talking to is a lunatic}

topics.topic_text: What's it like living at Tenpenny Tower?
topics.response_text: Tenpenny is a classy place. Just look at me. Look at my shop. Can't find top shelf class like that anywhere else.{self important snob}

topics.topic_text: Good thing the tower was still structurally sound after the war.
topics.response_text: Indeed. Though Tenpenny has put a lot of work into restoring it. And he's hired security to keep us safe.{bragging}

topics.topic_text: This place feels more like a prison than a home.
topics.response_text: I've never been in prison, so I wouldn't know. All I know is that I'm safe in here. Out there you got all kinds of nastiness. Like those Ghouls.{defending her gated community}

topics.topic_text: <Say nothing.>
topics.response_text: Not used to civilized discourse, eh? You're from out there in the Wasteland, right? You must be pretty tough to survive out there. Ever kill a Ghoul?{hinting the player can help }

topics.topic_text: Are you afraid of the Ghouls trying to get into Tenpenny?
topics.response_text: If they got in here, they'd get their filth over everything. You can smell them a mile away!{self important snob}

topics.topic_text: I can handle those Ghouls.
topics.response_text: Really? Perhaps you can. We'd all be terribly grateful. Chief Gustavo will want to know you're willing to help.{happy someone is finally taking charge}

topics.topic_text: I make it a point to stay clear of trouble.
topics.response_text: Well... I just thought... Never mind.{self important indignation}

topics.topic_text: Good luck.
topics.response_text: Yeah. Thanks.{mild sarcasm}

topics.topic_text: How would you feel about having a few Ghoul neighbors?
topics.response_text: Ah yes. I was wondering when you'd try me.{sarcastically sweet}

topics.topic_text: Yeah, Ghouls would make horrible neighbors.
topics.response_text: Quite right. Perhaps you're not as stupid as you seem.{(agreeing) self important snob}

topics.topic_text: I've met these Ghouls. They're civilized and pose no threat.
topics.response_text: I think you must have been out in the sun too long. Perhaps I could sell you a nice hat to keep your brain from frying?{self important snob}

topics.topic_text: Whatever.
topics.response_text: Is there something I can help you with? If not, why don't you find somewhere else to be?{self important snob}

topics.topic_text: SpeechChallengeFailure
topics.response_text: Who do you think you are? I pay good money to live here. And I run a most prestigious store. You can't push me around like that!{self important snob}

topics.topic_text: Tell me about Allistair Tenpenny.
topics.response_text: He stays in his penthouse suite most of the time. So long as we pay the rent, he lets us live here.

topics.topic_text: Nice place you have here.
topics.response_text: Your taste in shopping venue is impeccable. How may I assist you?{snobby merchant}

topics.topic_text: This is a store?
topics.response_text: You wouldn't know true value if it slapped you in the face!{snobby indignation}

topics.topic_text: Whatever.
topics.response_text: Just try not to break anything, okay?{snobby merchant talking to a poor person}

topics.topic_text: I'd like to do business with you.
topics.response_text: My Boutique has many unique items for the discerning customer.

conversation.response_text: We all feel safe knowing you and your men have this place locked up tight. Thank you!{genuinely appreciative}
Antique shop? Really, Anthony, you need some new material! And I'm not just talking about your jokes either, darling. Those threads are atrocious!{playful repartee}
Do you realize how often you use that word? You be careful, darling, or you'll wear it out like you've worn out your sense of style.{playfully teasing a friend}
At least I'm not some dried up tart, prancing around like the queen of America, carelessly spouting grotesque phrases. "Fabulousity?" Really now!{playful repartee ("fab-u-loss-i-tee")}
It's time for a little bite of something delicious.{hungry and on her way to get food}
Whew! I'm sleepy. Time to hit the pillows!{tired and heading off to bed}
Daring! What on earth are you up to?{confused and slightly suspicious}

combat.response_text: It's been a pleasure doing business.

description:
Lydia Montenegro is a 48 year-old Hispanic Female.

Lydia Montenegro is a middle-aged Hispanic woman who runs Boutique Le Chic, Tenpenny Tower's exclusive general store. She presents herself with an air of sophistication, despite selling salvaged goods to wasteland dwellers. With her impeccably styled hair and designer (though faded) clothing, she stands out among the tower's other residents. Her shop is meticulously organized, with items displayed as if they were high-end fashion rather than post-apocalyptic necessities.

Lydia Montenegro's Personality: Lydia is an elitist snob who maintains an illusion of high society within the confines of Tenpenny Tower. She speaks in a refined manner and treats her modest shop as if it were a luxury boutique. Despite her outward appearance of confidence, she is actually quite insecure and will flee at the first sign of trouble, particularly if her personal safe is compromised. She values her comfortable position in the tower and is resistant to any changes that might disrupt her carefully maintained lifestyle.

Lydia Montenegro's Backstory: Born before the Great War, Lydia grew up in the relative safety of a Vault. After leaving the Vault as a young adult, she struggled to find her place in the wasteland. She eventually made her way to Tenpenny Tower, recognizing an opportunity to establish herself as a merchant. Using her keen business sense and eye for presentation, she transformed a simple storage room into Boutique Le Chic, becoming one of the tower's more successful residents. Over the years, she has cultivated friendships with other tower elites like Michael Hawthorne, forming a small social circle that reinforces her sense of superiority over the 'common wastelander.'
